decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog, then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Unearth to bring them back onto the battlefield for powerful attacks. Stitcher's Supplier and Hedron Crab help with graveyard filling, while Emperor of Bones and Psychic Frog provide additional support. The deck's strategy revolves around taking advantage of instant reanimation effects to surprise opponents and overwhelm them with huge threats early in the game. Phyrexian Tower and Undercity Sewers provide additional mana support for casting spells and activating abilities.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard to search for key pieces, the deck aims to control the board and out value the opponent. With a combination of removal spells like Fatal Push and creatures like Solitude, the deck can deal with threats efficiently. By combining disruptive elements with a fast clock, the deck aims to disrupt opposing strategies while quickly closing out the game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly mill the opponent's deck by utilizing cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, and Hedron Crab. The goal is to get your opponent to run out of cards in their library, causing them to lose the game. The deck also includes cards like Drown in the Loch and Fatal Push for removal and disruption, as well as cards like Surgical Extraction to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently mill the opponent while controlling the game and disrupting their strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures and spells to create a toolbox of options for different situations. It includes cards like Birthing Ritual and Chord of Calling to quickly bring out creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck also includes cards like Viscera Seer and Carrion Feeder to sacrifice creatures for value, and uses cards like Samwise Gamgee and Malevolent Rumble to control the board. The deck has a versatile game plan that can adapt to different matchups and situations to achieve victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. Utilizing powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with support from Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the start. With cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison to control the board, along with Goblin Bombardment for additional reach, this deck looks to close out games swiftly through a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to gain additional mana advantage by untapping lands. It aims to ramp quickly into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and land destruction. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle allows for potential combo finishers to deal significant damage. The deck also includes utility lands like Tolaria West and Vesuva to search for key pieces and copy powerful lands. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces to overpower the opponent quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It uses a combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support and disruption, while Tribal Flames can deal a significant amount of damage in the late game. Overall, the deck aims to end the game swiftly through aggressive plays and efficient removal.
